alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Greater Caldwell; Iredell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CATAWBA... ALEXANDER...NORTHWESTERN IREDELL AND EAST CENTRAL CALDWELL COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Taylorsville, or 4 miles north of Bethlehem, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylorsville, Bethlehem, Stony Point, Love Valley, Lake Hickory, St. Stephens, Hiddenite, Little River In Alexander County, Millersville, and Ellendale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
